trans-unit.source: Windows App Certification Kit
trans-unit.target: Windows App Certification Kit

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: To give your app the best chance of being [published on the Windows Store](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh694062), or becoming [Windows Certified](https://msdn.microsoft.com/windows/desktop/jj134964.aspx), validate and test it locally before you submit it for certification.
trans-unit.target: To give your app the best chance of being [published on the Windows Store](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh694062), or becoming [Windows Certified](https://msdn.microsoft.com/windows/desktop/jj134964.aspx), validate and test it locally before you submit it for certification.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to install and run the [Windows App Certification Kit](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=309666).
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to install and run the [Windows App Certification Kit](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=309666).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for testing a Universal Windows app:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for testing a Universal Windows app:

trans-unit.source: You must install and run Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: You must install and run Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: You must install [Windows App Certification Kit version 10]( http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=309666), which is included in the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: You must install [Windows App Certification Kit version 10]( http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=309666), which is included in the Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) for Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: You must have a valid developer license for your computer.
trans-unit.target: You must have a valid developer license for your computer.

trans-unit.source: See [Get a developer license](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh974578) to learn how.
trans-unit.target: See [Get a developer license](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh974578) to learn how.

trans-unit.source: You must deploy the Windows app that you want to test to your computer.
trans-unit.target: You must deploy the Windows app that you want to test to your computer.

trans-unit.source: A note about in-place upgrades
trans-unit.target: A note about in-place upgrades

trans-unit.source: The installation of a more recent [Windows App Certification Kit]( http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=309666) will replace any previous version of the kit that is installed on the machine.
trans-unit.target: The installation of a more recent [Windows App Certification Kit]( http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=309666) will replace any previous version of the kit that is installed on the machine.

trans-unit.source: Validate your Windows app using the Windows App Certification Kit interactively
trans-unit.target: Validate your Windows app using the Windows App Certification Kit interactively

trans-unit.source: From the **Start** menu, search **Apps**, find **Windows Kits**, and click **Windows App Cert Kit**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Start** menu, search **Apps**, find **Windows Kits**, and click **Windows App Cert Kit**.

trans-unit.source: From the Windows App Certification Kit, select the category of validation you would like to perform.
trans-unit.target: From the Windows App Certification Kit, select the category of validation you would like to perform.

trans-unit.source: For example: If you are validating a Windows app, select **Validate a Windows app**.
trans-unit.target: For example: If you are validating a Windows app, select **Validate a Windows app**.

trans-unit.source: You may browse directly to the app you're testing, or choose the app from a list in the UI.
trans-unit.target: You may browse directly to the app you're testing, or choose the app from a list in the UI.

trans-unit.source: When the Windows App Certification Kit is run for the first time, the UI lists all the Windows apps that you have installed on your computer.
trans-unit.target: When the Windows App Certification Kit is run for the first time, the UI lists all the Windows apps that you have installed on your computer.

trans-unit.source: For any subsequent runs, the UI will display the most recent Windows apps that you have validated.
trans-unit.target: For any subsequent runs, the UI will display the most recent Windows apps that you have validated.

trans-unit.source: If the app that you want to test is not listed, you can click on **My app isn't listed** to get a comprehensive list of all apps installed on your system.
trans-unit.target: If the app that you want to test is not listed, you can click on **My app isn't listed** to get a comprehensive list of all apps installed on your system.

trans-unit.source: After you have input or selected the app that you want to test, click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: After you have input or selected the app that you want to test, click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: From the next screen, you will see the test workflow that aligns to the app type you are testing.
trans-unit.target: From the next screen, you will see the test workflow that aligns to the app type you are testing.

trans-unit.source: If a test is grayed out in the list, the test is not applicable to your environment.
trans-unit.target: If a test is grayed out in the list, the test is not applicable to your environment.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you are testing a Windows 10 app on Windows 7, only static tests will apply to the workflow.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you are testing a Windows 10 app on Windows 7, only static tests will apply to the workflow.

trans-unit.source: Note that the Windows Store may apply all tests from this workflow.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Windows Store may apply all tests from this workflow.

trans-unit.source: Select the tests you want to run and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select the tests you want to run and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: The Windows App Certification Kit begins validating the app.
trans-unit.target: The Windows App Certification Kit begins validating the app.

trans-unit.source: At the prompt after the test, enter the path to the folder where you want to save the test report.
trans-unit.target: At the prompt after the test, enter the path to the folder where you want to save the test report.

trans-unit.source: The Windows App Certification Kit creates an HTML along with an XML report and saves it in this folder.
trans-unit.target: The Windows App Certification Kit creates an HTML along with an XML report and saves it in this folder.

trans-unit.source: Open the report file and review the results of the test.
trans-unit.target: Open the report file and review the results of the test.

trans-unit.source: **Note** If you're using Visual Studio, you can run the Windows App Certification Kit when you create your app package.
trans-unit.target: **Note** If you're using Visual Studio, you can run the Windows App Certification Kit when you create your app package.

trans-unit.source: See [Packaging UWP apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt627715) to learn how.
trans-unit.target: See [Packaging UWP apps](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt627715) to learn how.

trans-unit.source: Validate your Windows app using the Windows App Certification Kit from a command line
trans-unit.target: Validate your Windows app using the Windows App Certification Kit from a command line

trans-unit.source: **Important** The Windows App Certification Kit must be run within the context of an active user session.
trans-unit.target: **Important** The Windows App Certification Kit must be run within the context of an active user session.

trans-unit.source: In the command window, navigate to the directory that contains the Windows App Certification Kit.
trans-unit.target: In the command window, navigate to the directory that contains the Windows App Certification Kit.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The default path is C:\\Program Files\\Windows Kits\\10\\App Certification Kit\\.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The default path is C:\\Program Files\\Windows Kits\\10\\App Certification Kit\\.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following commands in this order to test an app that is already installed on your test computer:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following commands in this order to test an app that is already installed on your test computer:

trans-unit.source: Or you can use the following commands if the app is not installed.
trans-unit.target: Or you can use the following commands if the app is not installed.

trans-unit.source: The Windows App Certification Kit will open the package and apply the appropriate test workflow:
trans-unit.target: The Windows App Certification Kit will open the package and apply the appropriate test workflow:

trans-unit.source: After the test completes, open the report file named `[report file name]` and review the test results.
trans-unit.target: After the test completes, open the report file named `[report file name]` and review the test results.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The Windows App Certification Kit can be run from a service, but the service must initiate the kit process within an active user session and cannot be run in Session0.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The Windows App Certification Kit can be run from a service, but the service must initiate the kit process within an active user session and cannot be run in Session0.

trans-unit.source: **Note** For more info about the Windows App Certification Kit command line, enter the command
trans-unit.target: **Note** For more info about the Windows App Certification Kit command line, enter the command

trans-unit.source: Testing with a low-power computer
trans-unit.target: Testing with a low-power computer

trans-unit.source: The performance test thresholds of the Windows App Certification Kit are based on the performance of a low-power computer.
trans-unit.target: The performance test thresholds of the Windows App Certification Kit are based on the performance of a low-power computer.

trans-unit.source: The characteristics of the computer on which the test is performed can influence the test results.
trans-unit.target: The characteristics of the computer on which the test is performed can influence the test results.

trans-unit.source: To determine if your app’s performance meets the [Windows Store Policies](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn764944), we recommend that you test your app on a low-power computer, such as an Intel Atom processor-based computer with a screen resolution of 1366x768 (or higher) and a rotational hard drive (as opposed to a solid-state hard drive).
trans-unit.target: To determine if your app’s performance meets the [Windows Store Policies](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn764944), we recommend that you test your app on a low-power computer, such as an Intel Atom processor-based computer with a screen resolution of 1366x768 (or higher) and a rotational hard drive (as opposed to a solid-state hard drive).

trans-unit.source: As low-power computers evolve, their performance characteristics might change over time.
trans-unit.target: As low-power computers evolve, their performance characteristics might change over time.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the most current [Windows Store Policies](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn764944) and test your app with the most current version of the Windows App Certification Kit to make sure that your app complies with the latest performance requirements.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the most current [Windows Store Policies](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn764944) and test your app with the most current version of the Windows App Certification Kit to make sure that your app complies with the latest performance requirements.
